docs.snippet: The Justice Department’s case to block AT&T’s $85 billion merger with Time Warner is set for trial next week, in one of the most anticipated antitrust battles in years.

docs.snippet: The longtime maestro of the Met Opera was fired after an investigation found evidence of misconduct. Readers shared their thoughts.

docs.snippet: A video showed officers handcuffing the man, who was wearing only his underwear, and placing him into a police vehicle before hugging one another.

docs.snippet: In “Just the Funny Parts,” Nell Scovell — who’s crafted jokes for everyone from David Letterman to President Obama — describes the toxic misogyny she’s endured.

headline.main: Come-Ons, Takedowns and Insults: What It’s Like to Write Comedy as a Woman

docs.snippet: A memoir by Sarah McBride, the first openly trans person to speak at a major party convention, details her life’s battles both public and private.

headline.main: Why ‘Tomorrow Will Be Different’ for the Transgender Community
